lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/TalkingBot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run TalkingBot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Class serving as the entry point of the application.
* @param fileName Path to text file saving the list of tasks.
* A class that represents the "bye" command entered by the user.
* @param commandArr String array containing the command.
* Prints a goodbye message, saves current list to a file,
* and stops the running of the program.
public void runCommand(TaskList tasks, SaveFile saveFile, Ui ui) {

* Returns the String array specifying the command to be executed.

public abstract void runCommand(TaskList tasks, SaveFile saveFile, Ui ui);

* Prints out the list of Tasks to the standard output.
public void runCommand(TaskList tasks, SaveFile saveFile, Ui ui) {

public void runCommand(TaskList tasks, SaveFile saveFile, Ui ui) {

* @param commandArr String array containing the command.

* and catches any exceptions that may occur before also
* printing them to the standard output.
public void runCommand(TaskList tasks, SaveFile saveFile, Ui ui) {

* @param commandArr String array containing the command.

* passes it to a static method for a Task to be generated,
* then tries to add such Task to the list of Tasks while printing to the standard output. Catches
* an exception if any occur and prints it to the standard output.
